card.name: About Face
card.ability: Switch target creature's power and toughness until end of turn.
card.flavor: The overconfident are the most vulnerable.
card.ruling:
11/1/2005 : Note that the wording "Effects that alter the creature's power alter its toughness instead, and vice versa, this turn" has been removed.
4/15/2013 : Effects that switch power and toughness apply after all other effects that change power and/or toughness, regardless of which effect was created first.
4/15/2013 : Switching a creature’s power and toughness twice (or any even number of times) effectively returns the creature to the power and toughness it had before any switches.

card.name: Angelic Curator
card.ability: Flying, protection from artifacts
card.flavor:
"Do not treat your people as you treat your artifacts. Let them go, and they will live; seal them here, and they will die."
—Urza, to Radiant

card.name: Angel's Trumpet
card.ability:
All creatures have vigilance.
At the beginning of each player's end step, tap all untapped creatures that player controls that didn't attack this turn. Angel's Trumpet deals damage to the player equal to the number of creatures tapped this way.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Angel's Trumpet affects creatures with Defender and other creatures that can't attack for some reason.
10/4/2004 : It does not affect creatures which did not attack, but which are already tapped at the time the ability resolves.

card.name: Anthroplasm
card.ability:
Anthroplasm enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it.
{X}, {T}: Remove all +1/+1 counters from Anthroplasm and put X +1/+1 counters on it.
card.flavor: I never metamorphosis I didn't like.
card.ruling: 10/1/2009 : While Anthroplasm does become 0/0 for a moment while its ability resolves, state-based actions are not checked until the ability has finished resolving. By that time, it will have some +1/+1 counters on it (assuming X was greater than 0), and so will not be put into its owner's graveyard.

card.name: Archivist
card.ability: {T}: Draw a card.
card.flavor: Some do. Some teach. The rest look it up.

card.name: Aura Flux
card.ability: Other enchantments have "At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice this enchantment unless you pay {2}."
card.flavor: To some, the Tolarian sunrise was a blinding flash; to others, a lingering glow.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : If two or more Aura Fluxes are on the battlefield, they will give the text to each other. And they will cause each other enchantment to have two triggered abilities for which the player would have to pay.
10/4/2004 : This card adds a triggered ability to all other enchantments.
10/4/2004 : You choose whether to pay {2} or not on resolution. If not, then you sacrifice the enchantment.

card.name: Avalanche Riders
card.ability:
Haste
Echo {3}{R} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
When Avalanche Riders enters the battlefield, destroy target land.

card.name: Beast of Burden
card.ability: Beast of Burden's power and toughness are each equal to the number of creatures on the battlefield.
card.flavor: "If it is meant to be nothing but a machine," Karn finally asked Jhoira, "why did Urza build it to be like me?"

card.name: Blessed Reversal
card.ability: You gain 3 life for each creature attacking you.
card.flavor: Even an enemy is a valuable resource.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The creatures are counted on resolution.

card.name: Bloated Toad
card.ability:
Protection from blue
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
card.ruling: 10/1/2008 : Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

card.name: Bone Shredder
card.ability:
Flying
Echo {2}{B} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
When Bone Shredder enters the battlefield, destroy target nonartifact, nonblack creature.

card.name: Bouncing Beebles
card.ability: Bouncing Beebles is unblockable as long as defending player controls an artifact.
card.flavor: Beebles are frequently hurled against stone surfaces at high speed but always zing back into the air with a giggle.

card.name: Brink of Madness
card.ability: At the beginning of your upkeep, if you have no cards in hand, sacrifice Brink of Madness and target opponent discards his or her hand.
card.flavor:
"The fools thought me dead. But I built an empire inside my tomb."
—Kerrick, sleeper agent
card.ruling:
6/15/2010 : The ability only triggers if you have no cards in your hand as your upkeep step begins.
6/15/2010 : You must sacrifice Brink of Madness if possible, but the opponent discards his or her hand even if you can't sacrifice it for some reason (for example, if it were returned to its owner's hand before the ability resolved).

card.name: Burst of Energy
card.ability: Untap target permanent.
card.flavor:
"I stand ready to die for our world. Who will stand with me?"
—Radiant, archangel

card.name: Cessation
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't attack.
When Cessation is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, return Cessation to its owner's hand.
card.flavor:
"The face of Light will shine upon them, and they will know war no more."
—Song of All, canto 918

card.name: Cloud of Faeries
card.ability:
Flying
When Cloud of Faeries enters the battlefield, untap up to two lands.
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : You can untap another player's lands.
10/4/2004 : This does not target the lands.
10/4/2004 : You can untap 0, 1, or 2 lands.
10/1/2008 : Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

card.name: Crawlspace
card.ability: No more than two creatures can attack you each combat.
card.flavor: The goblins did not understand their attraction to the mana rig. They simply knew it was where they belonged.

card.name: Crop Rotation
card.ability:
As an additional cost to cast Crop Rotation, sacrifice a land.
Search your library for a land card and put that card onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
card.flavor: "Hmm . . . maybe lotuses this year."

card.name: Damping Engine
card.ability: A player who controls more permanents than each other player can't play lands or cast artifact, creature, or enchantment spells. That player may sacrifice a permanent for that player to ignore this effect until end of turn.
card.ruling:
8/1/2008 : A player affected by this card can sacrifice a permanent any time he or she could cast an instant. This is a special action that doesn't use the stack and can't be responded to.
8/1/2008 : A player can only sacrifice a permanent to end this effect if he or she has more permanents than any other player, and he or she hasn't already sacrificed a permanent to end the effect this turn. The ability to sacrifice a creature is granted by the same effect that is being ended.

card.name: Darkwatch Elves
card.ability:
Protection from black
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
card.ruling: 10/1/2008 : Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

card.name: Defender of Chaos
card.ability:
Flash
Protection from white
card.flavor: Some knights will not follow orders—only disorder.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : This card is always a creature spell and is never an instant spell, no matter when you cast it.

card.name: Defender of Law
card.ability:
Flash
Protection from red
card.flavor: "It is not my place to question Radiant's rule. I exist to enforce her will."
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : This card is always a creature spell and is never an instant spell, no matter when you cast it.

card.name: Defense Grid
card.ability: Each spell costs {3} more to cast except during its controller's turn.
card.flavor:
"We've managed to keep the goblins in their assigned areas, but there's little we can do about the smell."
—Whip Tongue, viashino technician
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The additional cost can be reduced by effects that reduce costs, such as Sapphire Medallion.
5/1/2006 : In Two-Headed Giant, spells don’t cost extra on your own turn.

card.name: Defense of the Heart
card.ability: At the beginning of your upkeep, if an opponent controls three or more creatures, sacrifice Defense of the Heart, search your library for up to two creature cards, and put those cards onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : In a multiplayer game, it triggers if at least one opponent controls three or more creatures.
10/4/2004 : You choose how many cards to put onto the battlefield during the resolution after you look through your library. You do not choose as the ability goes on the stack.
10/4/2004 : This triggered ability only triggers if your opponent controls 3 or more creatures at the beginning of upkeep. This condition is checked again on resolution.
4/1/2008 : A "creature card" is any card with the type Creature, even if it has other types such as Artifact, Enchantment, or Land. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature cards.
6/15/2010 : If this card is not on the battlefield at the time it resolves, then you can't sacrifice it. You still perform the search and put any creature cards you find onto the battlefield.

card.name: Delusions of Mediocrity
card.ability:
When Delusions of Mediocrity enters the battlefield, you gain 10 life.
When Delusions of Mediocrity leaves the battlefield, you lose 10 life.
card.flavor: When nothing but second best will do.

card.name: Deranged Hermit
card.ability:
Echo {3}{G}{G} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
When Deranged Hermit enters the battlefield, put four 1/1 green Squirrel creature tokens onto the battlefield.
Squirrel creatures get +1/+1.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The Squirrel tokens get the bonus, so they are effectively 2/2 creatures until the Hermit leaves the battlefield. And they get bigger if multiple Hermits are on the battlefield.

card.name: Devout Harpist
card.ability: {T}: Destroy target Aura attached to a creature.
card.flavor: The notes themselves are irrelevant. The music's effect, however, is worth ten armies.
card.ruling: 8/1/2005 : It can only target "Enchantment - Aura" cards, which includes cards changed into Auras, such as Licids.

card.name: Engineered Plague
card.ability:
As Engineered Plague enters the battlefield, choose a creature type.
All creatures of the chosen type get -1/-1.
card.flavor:
"The admixture of bitterwort in the viral brew has produced most favorable results."
—Phyrexian progress notes

card.name: Erase
card.ability: Exile target enchantment.
card.flavor: Perception is more pleasing than truth.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The card does not go to the graveyard first.

card.name: Eviscerator
card.ability:
Protection from white
When Eviscerator enters the battlefield, you lose 5 life.
card.flavor: It roamed the time bubble like a captured animal. Kerrick knew he must soon find a way to unleash it on Tolaria or destroy it.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : This is loss of life, and not damage. It can't be prevented.

card.name: Expendable Troops
card.ability: {T}, Sacrifice Expendable Troops: Expendable Troops deals 2 damage to target attacking or blocking creature.
card.flavor: No doubt in their minds, no fear in their hearts.

card.name: Faerie Conclave
card.ability:
Faerie Conclave enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {U} to your mana pool.
{1}{U}: Faerie Conclave becomes a 2/1 blue Faerie creature with flying until end of turn. It's still a land. (It can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
card.ruling:
8/1/2008 : A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature is subject to the "summoning sickness" rule: It can only attack, and its {T} abilities can only be activated, if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of his or her most recent turn.
10/1/2009 : The layering rules have changed. Now if you animate a land and its power and toughness are lowered by Mutilate or a similar effect, reactivating the land's ability won't reset the values. This is because you apply all effects that set power and toughness to specific values before you apply any that modify power and toughness, regardless of the order in which the effects resolve.

card.name: Fleeting Image
card.ability:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
{1}{U}: Return Fleeting Image to its owner's hand.
card.flavor: Horas swore off drinking, but after meeting the creature a second time he decided he'd better start again.

card.name: Fog of Gnats
card.ability:
Flying
{B}: Regenerate Fog of Gnats.
card.flavor: You can swat a thousand gnats, but a thousand more will assail you.

card.name: Forbidding Watchtower
card.ability:
Forbidding Watchtower enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {W} to your mana pool.
{1}{W}: Forbidding Watchtower becomes a 1/5 white Soldier creature until end of turn. It's still a land.
card.ruling:
8/1/2008 : A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature is subject to the "summoning sickness" rule: It can only attack, and its {T} abilities can only be activated, if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of his or her most recent turn.
10/1/2009 : The layering rules have changed. Now if you animate a land and its power and toughness are lowered by Mutilate or a similar effect, reactivating the land's ability won't reset the values. This is because you apply all effects that set power and toughness to specific values before you apply any that modify power and toughness, regardless of the order in which the effects resolve.

card.name: Frantic Search
card.ability: Draw two cards, then discard two cards. Untap up to three lands.
card.flavor: Motivation was high in the academy once students realized flunking their exams could kill them.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : You can untap another player's lands.
10/4/2004 : This does not target the lands.

card.name: Gang of Elk
card.ability: Whenever Gang of Elk becomes blocked, it gets +2/+2 until end of turn for each creature blocking it.
card.flavor: The elk is Gaea's favorite, who wears the forest on its brow.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Gang of Elk gets the bonus once for each blocker.

card.name: Ghitu Encampment
card.ability:
Ghitu Encampment enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {R} to your mana pool.
{1}{R}: Ghitu Encampment becomes a 2/1 red Warrior creature with first strike until end of turn. It's still a land. (It deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
card.ruling:
8/1/2008 : A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature is subject to the "summoning sickness" rule: It can only attack, and its {T} abilities can only be activated, if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of his or her most recent turn.
10/1/2009 : The layering rules have changed. Now if you animate a land and its power and toughness are lowered by Mutilate or a similar effect, reactivating the land's ability won't reset the values. This is because you apply all effects that set power and toughness to specific values before you apply any that modify power and toughness, regardless of the order in which the effects resolve.

card.name: Ghitu Fire-Eater
card.ability: {T}, Sacrifice Ghitu Fire-Eater: Ghitu Fire-Eater deals damage equal to its power to target creature or player.
card.flavor:
"They are called ‘Mi'uto,' which means ‘one use.'"
—Jhoira, artificer

card.name: Ghitu Slinger
card.ability:
Echo {2}{R} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
When Ghitu Slinger enters the battlefield, it deals 2 damage to target creature or player.
card.flavor: If you survive a slinger attack, the slinger wished you to live.

card.name: Ghitu War Cry
card.ability: {R}: Target creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
card.flavor: The war cry is not simply a shout but a sacrament.

card.name: Giant Cockroach
card.flavor: If the sun ever hit the swamp, where would these scurry to?

card.name: Goblin Medics
card.ability: Whenever Goblin Medics becomes tapped, it deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
card.flavor:
"First, do some harm."
—Oath of Goblins
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The ability does trigger when it taps to attack.

card.name: Goblin Welder
card.ability: {T}: Choose target artifact a player controls and target artifact card in that player's graveyard. If both targets are still legal as this ability resolves, that player simultaneously sacrifices the artifact and returns the artifact card to the battlefield.
card.flavor: "I wrecked your metal guy, boss. But look I made you an ashtray."
card.ruling: 8/1/2008 : As the new wording makes clear, both targets must still be legal as the ability resolves in order for it to do anything. If either one or both has become illegal, nothing gets sacrificed and nothing gets returned to the battlefield.

card.name: Granite Grip
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+0 for each Mountain you control.
card.flavor: There's beauty in the desert—but it's best to view it from afar.

card.name: Grim Monolith
card.ability:
Grim Monolith doesn't untap during your untap step.
{T}: Add {3} to your mana pool.
{4}: Untap Grim Monolith.
card.flavor: Part prison, part home.

card.name: Harmonic Convergence
card.ability: Put all enchantments on top of their owners' libraries.
card.flavor: When the eternal stars align, can mere mortals resist?
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : If any player needs to put more than one enchantment on top of their library, they choose the order.

card.name: Hidden Gibbons
card.ability: When an opponent casts an instant spell, if Hidden Gibbons is an enchantment, Hidden Gibbons becomes a 4/4 Ape creature.
card.flavor: When these apes want something, it's a matter of gibbon take.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : When it turns into a creature, it is no longer an enchantment.
10/4/2004 : It changes into a creature even if the spell is countered.
8/1/2008 : The ability triggers when the spell is cast, so it becomes a creature before the spell resolves.
8/1/2008 : A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature is subject to the "summoning sickness" rule: It can only attack, and its {T} abilities can only be activated, if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of his or her most recent turn.

card.name: Hope and Glory
card.ability: Untap two target creatures. Each of them gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"Serra ruled by faith. I cannot afford that luxury."
—Radiant, archangel
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Must target two different creatures.

card.name: Impending Disaster
card.ability: At the beginning of your upkeep, if there are seven or more lands on the battlefield, sacrifice Impending Disaster and destroy all lands.
card.flavor:
"The goblins are in charge of maintenance? Why not just set it on fire now and call it a day?"
—Whip Tongue, viashino technician
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : This ability does not trigger at all if there are not seven lands on the battlefield at the beginning of upkeep. It checks this number again when it is going to resolve and does not do anything if the land count is below 7.
10/4/2004 : The ability is not optional.
6/15/2010 : If this card is not on the battlefield at the times its ability resolves, then you can't sacrifice it. However, you still destroy all lands.

card.name: Intervene
card.ability: Counter target spell that targets a creature.
card.flavor:
"At first I simply observed. But I found that without investment in others, life serves no purpose."
—Karn, silver golem
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : If a spell is modal, use the target(s) of the current mode only for this check. Targets for the other modes are never selected.
10/4/2004 : Intervene can only target a spell that is currently targeting a creature.
10/4/2004 : It means "targeting at least one creature" not "exactly one creature".
10/4/2004 : If the spell's target leaves the battlefield before this spell resolves, Intervene will be countered since it no longer targets a spell that targets a creature.

card.name: Iron Maiden
card.ability: At the beginning of each opponent's upkeep, Iron Maiden deals X damage to that player, where X is the number of cards in his or her hand minus 4.
card.flavor: The maiden is a jealous lover.

card.name: Iron Will
card.ability:
Target creature gets +0/+4 until end of turn.
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
card.ruling: 10/1/2008 : Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

card.name: Jhoira's Toolbox
card.ability: {2}: Regenerate target artifact creature.
card.flavor: It entertained Jhoira to craft a kit that could bring her the tools.

card.name: Karmic Guide
card.ability:
Flying, protection from black
Echo {3}{W}{W} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
When Karmic Guide enters the battlefield, return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.
card.ruling: 4/1/2008 : A "creature card" is any card with the type Creature, even if it has other types such as Artifact, Enchantment, or Land. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature cards.

card.name: King Crab
card.ability: {1}{U}, {T}: Put target green creature on top of its owner's library.
card.flavor:
"I'm allergic to shellfish—not only did it kill my entire village, it also gave me this nasty rash."
—Olivia, fisher

card.name: Knighthood
card.ability: Creatures you control have first strike.
card.flavor:
"He has returned. He who brought the dark ones. He who poisoned our paradise. How shall we greet him? With swift and certain death"
—Radiant, archangel

card.name: Last-Ditch Effort
card.ability: Sacrifice any number of creatures. Last-Ditch Effort deals that much damage to target creature or player.
card.flavor:
"If you're gonna lose, at least make sure they don't win as much."
—Jula, goblin raider
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The creatures are chosen and sacrificed on resolution.
10/4/2004 : It deals one damage for each creature sacrificed.

card.name: Lava Axe
card.ability: Lava Axe deals 5 damage to target player.
card.flavor: "Catch"

card.name: Levitation
card.ability: Creatures you control have flying.
card.flavor: Barrin's pride in his apprentice was diminished somewhat when he had to get the others back down.

card.name: Lone Wolf
card.ability: You may have Lone Wolf assign its combat damage as though it weren't blocked.
card.flavor: A wolf without a pack is either a survivor or a brute.
card.ruling:
4/1/2008 : If this creature is attacking a planeswalker, assigning its damage as though it weren't blocked means the damage is assigned to the planeswalker, not to the defending player.
4/1/2008 : When assigning combat damage, you choose whether you want to assign all damage to blocking creatures, or if you want to assign all of it to the defending player or planeswalker. You can't split the damage assignment between them.
4/1/2008 : You can decide to assign damage to the defending player or planeswalker even if the blocking creature has protection from green or damage preventing effects on it.
4/1/2008 : If blocked by a creature with banding, the defending player decides whether or not the damage is assigned "as though it weren't blocked".

card.name: Lurking Skirge
card.ability: When a creature is put into an opponent's graveyard from the battlefield, if Lurking Skirge is an enchantment, Lurking Skirge becomes a 3/2 Imp creature with flying.
card.flavor: They never miss a funeral.
card.ruling: 8/1/2008 : A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature is subject to the "summoning sickness" rule: It can only attack, and its {T} abilities can only be activated, if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of his or her most recent turn.

card.name: Martyr's Cause
card.ability: Sacrifice a creature: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to target creature or player this turn, prevent that damage.
card.flavor: Dying is a soldier's talent.

card.name: Memory Jar
card.ability: {T}, Sacrifice Memory Jar: Each player exiles all cards from his or her hand face down and draws seven cards. At the beginning of the next end step, each player discards his or her hand and returns to his or her hand each card he or she exiled this way.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : You can't look at the cards you exiled until they return to your hand.

card.name: Might of Oaks
card.ability: Target creature gets +7/+7 until end of turn.
card.flavor: Suddenly, she couldn't see the acorns for the trees.

card.name: Miscalculation
card.ability:
Counter target spell unless its controller pays {2}.
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
card.ruling: 10/1/2008 : Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

card.name: Molten Hydra
card.ability:
{1}{R}{R}: Put a +1/+1 counter on Molten Hydra.
{T}, Remove all +1/+1 counters from Molten Hydra: Molten Hydra deals damage to target creature or player equal to the number of +1/+1 counters removed this way.
card.flavor: Keep off the glass.Hydra warning sign

card.name: Mother of Runes
card.ability: {T}: Target creature you control gains protection from the color of your choice until end of turn.
card.flavor: "My family protects all families."

card.name: Multani, Maro-Sorcerer
card.ability:
Shroud (This permanent can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
Multani, Maro-Sorcerer's power and toughness are each equal to the total number of cards in all players' hands.
card.flavor:
"To make peace with the forest, make peace with me."
—Multani, to Urza

card.name: Multani's Acolyte
card.ability:
Echo {G}{G} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
When Multani's Acolyte enters the battlefield, draw a card.

card.name: Multani's Presence
card.ability: Whenever a spell you've cast is countered, draw a card.
card.flavor: When a tree falls in the forest, Multani hears it.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Will trigger when a spell is countered due to all of its targets being illegal.

card.name: No Mercy
card.ability: Whenever a creature deals damage to you, destroy it.
card.flavor:
"We had years to prepare, while they had mere minutes."
—Kerrick, sleeper agent
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : If the damage to you is all prevented or redirected, then damage was not dealt to you, and this does not trigger.

card.name: Opal Avenger
card.ability: When you have 10 or less life, if Opal Avenger is an enchantment, Opal Avenger becomes a 3/5 Soldier creature.
card.flavor: As the sun grew cold in the realm, the statue grew warm.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : When it turns into a creature, it is no longer an enchantment.
8/1/2008 : A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature is subject to the "summoning sickness" rule: It can only attack, and its {T} abilities can only be activated, if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of his or her most recent turn.

card.name: Opal Champion
card.ability: When an opponent casts a creature spell, if Opal Champion is an enchantment, Opal Champion becomes a 3/3 Knight creature with first strike.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : It triggers when the spell is cast, so it becomes a creature before the spell resolves. A creature that would destroy an enchantment when it enters the battlefield can't be used to destroy this card, since it will no longer be an enchantment when the creature enters the battlefield.
10/4/2004 : When it turns into a creature, it is no longer an enchantment.
10/4/2004 : It changes into a creature even if the spell is countered.
4/1/2008 : A "creature spell" is any spell with the type Creature, even if it has other types such as Artifact or Enchantment. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature spells.
8/1/2008 : A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature is subject to the "summoning sickness" rule: It can only attack, and its {T} abilities can only be activated, if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of his or her most recent turn.

card.name: Opportunity
card.ability: Target player draws four cards.
card.flavor:
"He cocooned himself alone in his workshop for months. When he finally emerged, all broad grins and excited chatter, I knew he'd found his answer."
—Barrin, master wizard

card.name: Ostracize
card.ability: Target opponent reveals his or her hand. You choose a creature card from it. That player discards that card.
card.flavor: Kerrick was to find that some borders can never be crossed.
card.ruling: 4/1/2008 : A "creature card" is any card with the type Creature, even if it has other types such as Artifact, Enchantment, or Land. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature cards.

card.name: Palinchron
card.ability:
Flying
When Palinchron enters the battlefield, untap up to seven lands.
{2}{U}{U}: Return Palinchron to its owner's hand.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : You can untap 0 to 7 lands.
10/4/2004 : You can untap another player's lands.
10/4/2004 : This does not target the lands.

card.name: Parch
card.ability: Choose one — Parch deals 2 damage to target creature or player; or Parch deals 4 damage to target blue creature.
card.flavor:
"Your porous flesh betrays you."
—Fire Eye, viashino bey
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : You choose the mode when you announce the spell.
10/4/2004 : You can choose to use the 2 damage mode on a blue creature if you want.

card.name: Peace and Quiet
card.ability: Destroy two target enchantments.
card.flavor:
"In time our realm will shine again. But it will gleam only when we scour away the taint of doubt."
—Radiant, archangel
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Must target two different enchantments.

card.name: Phyrexian Broodlings
card.ability: {1}, Sacrifice a creature: Put a +1/+1 counter on Phyrexian Broodlings.
card.flavor: With limited resources and near unlimited time, Kerrick used parts from one beast to build another.

card.name: Phyrexian Debaser
card.ability:
Flying
{T}, Sacrifice Phyrexian Debaser: Target creature gets -2/-2 until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"The second stage of the illness: high fever and severe infectiousness."
—Phyrexian progress notes

card.name: Phyrexian Defiler
card.ability: {T}, Sacrifice Phyrexian Defiler: Target creature gets -3/-3 until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"The third stage of the illness: muscle aches and persistent cough."
—Phyrexian progress notes

card.name: Phyrexian Denouncer
card.ability: {T}, Sacrifice Phyrexian Denouncer: Target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"The first stage of the illness: rash and nausea."
—Phyrexian progress notes

card.name: Phyrexian Plaguelord
card.ability:
{T}, Sacrifice Phyrexian Plaguelord: Target creature gets -4/-4 until end of turn.
Sacrifice a creature: Target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"The final stage of the illness: delirium, convulsions, and death."
—Phyrexian progress notes

card.name: Phyrexian Reclamation
card.ability: {1}{B}, Pay 2 life: Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
card.flavor: Death is no excuse to stop working.
card.ruling: 4/1/2008 : A "creature card" is any card with the type Creature, even if it has other types such as Artifact, Enchantment, or Land. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature cards.

card.name: Plague Beetle
card.ability: Swampwalk (This creature is unblockable as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
card.flavor: It is the harbinger of disease, not the carrier.

card.name: Planar Collapse
card.ability: At the beginning of your upkeep, if there are four or more creatures on the battlefield, sacrifice Planar Collapse and destroy all creatures. They can't be regenerated.
card.flavor: With heavy heart, Urza doused one world's light to rekindle another's.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : This ability does not trigger at all if there are not 4 or more creatures on the battlefield. It also checks this at the start of resolution and does nothing if this is not still true.
10/4/2004 : The ability is not optional.
6/15/2010 : If this card is not on the battlefield when the ability resolves, then you can't sacrifice it. However, you still destroy all creatures.

card.name: Purify
card.ability: Destroy all artifacts and enchantments.
card.flavor:
"Our Mother The sky was Her hair; the sun, Her face. She danced on the grass and in the hills."
—Song of All, canto 23

card.name: Pygmy Pyrosaur
card.ability:
Pygmy Pyrosaur can't block.
{R}: Pygmy Pyrosaur gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
card.flavor:
Do not judge a lizard by its size.
—Ghitu proverb

card.name: Pyromancy
card.ability: {3}, Discard a card at random: Pyromancy deals damage to target creature or player equal to the converted mana cost of the discarded card.
card.flavor:
Who harnesses fire controls the world.
—Ghitu proverb
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : A card with X in the cost is treated as X=0.
10/4/2004 : You pick the target before you know which card is going to be discarded.

card.name: Quicksilver Amulet
card.ability: {4}, {T}: You may put a creature card from your hand onto the battlefield.
card.flavor: "Wonderful You got a lion on your first try. Now put it back."
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Any 'X' in the creature's cost is treated as zero.
5/1/2007 : Putting the card onto the battlefield is optional.  When the ability resolves, you can choose not to.
4/1/2008 : A "creature card" is any card with the type Creature, even if it has other types such as Artifact, Enchantment, or Land. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature cards.
9/22/2011 : You don't pay any costs of that creature card, including additional costs.

card.name: Rack and Ruin
card.ability: Destroy two target artifacts.
card.flavor:
"My people are bound by masters centuries dead. Each artifact we destroy is another link broken in that chain."
—Barb Tail, viashino heretic
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Must target two different artifacts.

card.name: Radiant, Archangel
card.ability:
Flying, vigilance
Radiant, Archangel gets +1/+1 for each other creature with flying on the battlefield.

card.name: Radiant's Dragoons
card.ability:
Echo {3}{W} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
When Radiant's Dragoons enters the battlefield, you gain 5 life.

card.name: Radiant's Judgment
card.ability:
Destroy target creature with power 4 or greater.
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
card.ruling: 10/1/2008 : Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

card.name: Rancor
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+0 and has trample.
When Rancor is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, return Rancor to its owner's hand.
card.flavor: Hatred outlives the hateful.
card.ruling: 7/1/2012 : If the target of Rancor when it's cast as a spell is an illegal target when Rancor tries to resolve, Rancor will be countered and put into its owner's graveyard. It won't return to its owner's hand.

card.name: Rank and File
card.ability: When Rank and File enters the battlefield, green creatures get -1/-1 until end of turn.
card.flavor: "Left, right, left, right . . . hmm. Okay—left, left, left, left, . . ."
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The -1/-1 penalty is given to all green creatures on the battlefield when the triggered ability resolves. It will not apply to green creatures that enter the battlefield later in the turn.

card.name: Raven Familiar
card.ability:
Flying
Echo {2}{U} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
When Raven Familiar enters the battlefield, look at the top three cards of your library. Put one of them into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : This is not a draw.

card.name: Rebuild
card.ability:
Return all artifacts to their owners' hands.
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Remember that cards only affect things which are on the battlefield unless they specifically say otherwise. So this only applies to artifacts on the battlefield.
10/1/2008 : Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

card.name: Repopulate
card.ability:
Shuffle all creature cards from target player's graveyard into that player's library.
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
card.ruling:
4/1/2008 : A "creature card" is any card with the type Creature, even if it has other types such as Artifact, Enchantment, or Land. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature cards.
10/1/2008 : Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

card.name: Ring of Gix
card.ability:
Echo {3} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
{1}, {T}: Tap target artifact, creature, or land.
card.flavor: Not every cage is made of bars.

card.name: Rivalry
card.ability: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, if that player controls more lands than each other player, Rivalry deals 2 damage to him or her.
card.flavor: The goblins revered it; the viashino defended it. Only Urza understood it.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : This ability will only trigger if the player controls more lands at the beginning of upkeep. This condition is checked again at the start of resolution, and if not true, then nothing happens.

card.name: Scrapheap
card.ability: Whenever an artifact or enchantment is put into your graveyard from the battlefield, you gain 1 life.
card.flavor: Junk heaps have rats, but scrapheaps have goblins.

card.name: Second Chance
card.ability: At the beginning of your upkeep, if you have 5 or less life, sacrifice Second Chance and take an extra turn after this one.
card.flavor: The greatest gift is the opportunity to right one's wrongs.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : It is not optional.
10/4/2004 : The ability will only trigger if you have 5 or less life at the beginning of upkeep. This is checked again at the start of resolution and nothing happens if you do not still have 5 or less life.
10/4/2004 : If multiple "extra turn" effects resolve in the same turn, take them in the reverse of the order that the effects resolved.
6/15/2010 : On resolution of the trigger you have to sacrifice this card if you have 5 life or less. If you can't (because it is not on the battlefield, for example), then you still take an extra turn after this one.

card.name: Shivan Phoenix
card.ability:
Flying
When Shivan Phoenix dies, return Shivan Phoenix to its owner's hand.
card.flavor: To strike down the phoenix is to slash at the flame.

card.name: Sick and Tired
card.ability: Two target creatures each get -1/-1 until end of turn.
card.flavor: The Phyrexians' only interest in organic life is discerning its weakness.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Must target two different creatures.

card.name: Silk Net
card.ability: Target creature gets +1/+1 and gains reach until end of turn. (It can block creatures with flying.)
card.flavor: Sometimes it's possible to pull a meal out of thin air.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Both the +1/+1 and reach only last until end of turn.
4/1/2008 : This card now uses the Reach keyword ability to enable the blocking of flying creatures. This works because a creature with flying can only be blocked by creatures with flying or reach.

card.name: Simian Grunts
card.ability:
Flash
Echo {2}{G} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
card.flavor: These monkeys mean business.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : This card is always a creature spell and is never an instant spell, no matter when you cast it.

card.name: Sleeper's Guile
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has fear. (It can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
When Sleeper's Guile is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, return Sleeper's Guile to its owner's hand.

card.name: Slow Motion
card.ability:
Enchant creature
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted creature's controller, that player sacrifices that creature unless he or she pays {2}.
When Slow Motion is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, return Slow Motion to its owner's hand.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : You choose whether to pay or not on resolution. If not, then you sacrifice the creature. You can choose to not pay if you no longer control the creature on resolution.

card.name: Sluggishness
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't block.
When Sluggishness is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, return Sluggishness to its owner's hand.
card.flavor: Vark decided to lie down and think of a good excuse to quit working.

card.name: Snap
card.ability: Return target creature to its owner's hand. Untap up to two lands.
card.flavor: Good riddance.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : You can untap another player's lands.
10/4/2004 : This does not target the lands.
10/4/2004 : You can untap 0, 1, or 2 lands.

card.name: Spawning Pool
card.ability:
Spawning Pool enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {B} to your mana pool.
{1}{B}: Spawning Pool becomes a 1/1 black Skeleton creature with "{B}: Regenerate this creature" until end of turn. It's still a land. (If it regenerates, the next time it would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)
card.ruling:
8/1/2008 : A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature is subject to the "summoning sickness" rule: It can only attack, and its {T} abilities can only be activated, if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of his or her most recent turn.
10/1/2009 : The layering rules have changed. Now if you animate a land and its power and toughness are lowered by Mutilate or a similar effect, reactivating the land's ability won't reset the values. This is because you apply all effects that set power and toughness to specific values before you apply any that modify power and toughness, regardless of the order in which the effects resolve.

card.name: Subversion
card.ability: At the beginning of your upkeep, each opponent loses 1 life. You gain life equal to the life lost this way.
card.flavor: Kerrick's corrupt domain swelled like a blister on Tolaria's skin.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : This is loss of life, not damage. It can't be prevented.

card.name: Sustainer of the Realm
card.ability:
Flying
Whenever Sustainer of the Realm blocks, it gets +0/+2 until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"The harder you push, the stronger we become."
—Radiant, to Urza
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : It gets the bonus only once, not once per creature it blocks.

card.name: Swat
card.ability:
Destroy target creature with power 2 or less.
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
card.ruling: 10/1/2008 : Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

card.name: Tethered Skirge
card.ability:
Flying
Whenever Tethered Skirge becomes the target of a spell or ability, you lose 1 life.
card.flavor: It bites the hand that leads it.

card.name: Thornwind Faeries
card.ability:
Flying
{T}: Thornwind Faeries deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
card.flavor: Guarding the ship is the Thornwinds' first concern. Getting along with the locals ranks fourth or fifth at best.

card.name: Thran Lens
card.ability: All permanents are colorless.
card.flavor:
"Every device in the rig is evidence of Thran enlightenment. All mana was the same to them, whether from rock or water, growth or decay. Can you imagine such unity of vision?"
—Urza, journal
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Does not make the permanents into artifacts. They are simply without color.
10/4/2004 : Does not prevent a spell or ability from adding color to permanents after this effect is applied.

card.name: Thran War Machine
card.ability:
Echo {4} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
Thran War Machine attacks each turn if able.

card.name: Thran Weaponry
card.ability:
Echo {4} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
You may choose not to untap Thran Weaponry during your untap step.
{2}, {T}: All creatures get +2/+2 for as long as Thran Weaponry remains tapped.

card.name: Ticking Gnomes
card.ability:
Echo {3} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
Sacrifice Ticking Gnomes: Ticking Gnomes deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

card.name: Tinker
card.ability:
As an additional cost to cast Tinker, sacrifice an artifact.
Search your library for an artifact card and put that card onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
card.flavor:
"I wonder how it feels to be bored."
—Jhoira, artificer
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

card.name: Tragic Poet
card.ability: {T}, Sacrifice Tragic Poet: Return target enchantment card from your graveyard to your hand.
card.flavor: "I would weep, but my tears have been stolen; I would shout, but my voice has been taken. Thus, I write."

card.name: Treacherous Link
card.ability:
Enchant creature
All damage that would be dealt to enchanted creature is dealt to its controller instead.
card.flavor:
"You cannot possibly know the toll your alliances will exact from you."
—Barrin, to Urza

card.name: Treefolk Mystic
card.ability: Whenever Treefolk Mystic blocks or becomes blocked by a creature, destroy all Auras attached to that creature.
card.flavor: Urza's wards fell from him like autumn leaves as he entered the dreaming grove. He awoke imprisoned in living wood.

card.name: Treetop Village
card.ability:
Treetop Village enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.
{1}{G}: Treetop Village becomes a 3/3 green Ape creature with trample until end of turn. It's still a land. (If it would assign enough damage to its blockers to destroy them, you may have it assign the rest of its damage to defending player or planeswalker.)
card.ruling:
8/1/2008 : A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature is subject to the "summoning sickness" rule: It can only attack, and its {T} abilities can only be activated, if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of his or her most recent turn.
10/1/2009 : The layering rules have changed. Now if you animate a land and its power and toughness are lowered by Mutilate or a similar effect, reactivating the land's ability won't reset the values. This is because you apply all effects that set power and toughness to specific values before you apply any that modify power and toughness, regardless of the order in which the effects resolve.

card.name: Unearth
card.ability:
Return target creature card with converted mana cost 3 or less from your graveyard to the battlefield.
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
card.ruling:
4/1/2008 : A "creature card" is any card with the type Creature, even if it has other types such as Artifact, Enchantment, or Land. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature cards.
10/1/2008 : Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

card.name: Urza's Blueprints
card.ability:
Echo {6} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
{T}: Draw a card.
card.flavor: From concept to paper to reality.

card.name: Viashino Bey
card.ability: If Viashino Bey attacks, all creatures you control attack if able.
card.flavor:
When the bey runs, match his stride.
—Viashino saying
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The ability is not a triggered ability. It is a constraint on declaring an attack.

card.name: Viashino Cutthroat
card.ability:
Haste
At the beginning of the end step, return Viashino Cutthroat to its owner's hand.
card.flavor:
"You guys go on ahead. I'll catch up with ya."
—Vark, goblin scout, last words
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : It is returned to its owner's hand at the end of turn only if it is on the battlefield.

card.name: Viashino Heretic
card.ability: {1}{R}, {T}: Destroy target artifact. Viashino Heretic deals damage to that artifact's controller equal to the artifact's converted mana cost.
card.flavor: "The past is buried for good reason."

card.name: Viashino Sandscout
card.ability:
Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
At the beginning of the end step, return Viashino Sandscout to its owner's hand. (Return it only if it's on the battlefield.)
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : It is returned to its owner's hand at the end of turn only if it is on the battlefield.

card.name: Vigilant Drake
card.ability:
Flying
{2}{U}: Untap Vigilant Drake.
card.flavor: Awake and awing in the blink of an eye.

card.name: Walking Sponge
card.ability: {T}: Target creature loses your choice of flying, first strike, or trample until end of turn.
card.flavor: Not only does it catch fish, it cleans them too.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The target loses just one of the listed abilities.

card.name: Weatherseed Elf
card.ability: {T}: Target creature gains forestwalk until end of turn.
card.flavor: "My grandmother once told me the future of our world was inside the Weatherseed. When I touched it, I knew she was right."

card.name: Weatherseed Faeries
card.ability: Flying, protection from red
card.flavor: Two days after the forge was completed, the faeries were immune to its flames.

card.name: Weatherseed Treefolk
card.ability:
Trample
When Weatherseed Treefolk dies, return it to its owner's hand.

card.name: Wheel of Torture
card.ability: At the beginning of each opponent's upkeep, Wheel of Torture deals X damage to that player, where X is 3 minus the number of cards in his or her hand.
card.flavor: "I'd like to buy a bowel."
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The number of cards is counted during resolution.

card.name: Wing Snare
card.ability: Destroy target creature with flying.
card.flavor:
"Argoth's doom rained from a clear sky. Yavimaya will not share that fate."
—Multani, maro-sorcerer

card.name: Yavimaya Granger
card.ability:
Echo {2}{G} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
When Yavimaya Granger enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a basic land card, put that card onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle your library.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

card.name: Yavimaya Scion
card.ability: Protection from artifacts
card.flavor: Each time the saw blade bit, the tree spat it out.

card.name: Yavimaya Wurm
card.ability: Trample (If this creature would assign enough damage to its blockers to destroy them, you may have it assign the rest of its damage to defending player or planeswalker.)
card.flavor: When the gorilla playfully grabbed the wurm's tail, the wurm doubled back and playfully ate the gorilla's head.
